description: A 32mb game file will not work on steam deck, asks if it's the right file type.
why would you want to run in desktop mode? are you stupid?
Sometimes it hangs and stutters, but overall good
Won't map controls for steam deck
The settings window is far too tall. It obscures the "Apply" button. While emulation is great with what I've started, I would like to be able to use my Steam Deck alone.

mGBA has been a solid emulator option for a while, comprehensive settings, support for Dolphin to emulate Link Cable features in compatible titles, etc.

Anyone with issues mapping the controls on Steam Deck should be aware - Deck controls are desktop at all times until Steam gives them a specific profile. If you wanna use mGBA on Deck, add it as a non-Steam app, set Controller Layout to a Gamepad option, and run it through Steam. You have to add it to Steam anyway if you wanna play in game mode!

Rating this 5 stars based on THE APPLICATION, NOT BASED ON ANY PEBCAC.

Unfortunately it's impossible to get the application to recognize inputs when used in desktop mode, unlike most other emulators that the deck supports. The only way to get it to hear the inputs is by adding it as a non-steam title, then running it in gaming mode. The problem is selecting games when running in game mode. Clearly this wasn't designed with Deck users in mind. On top of that, navigating the settings menu is impossible due to the menu screen size being larger than the resolution of the console. Not practical in its current state.
1, it doesn't recognize my inputs, 2, there's no bar at the top to access ANY settings.
title says all you need to know. unusable on steamdeck
the emulator is good. it is the only emuator that i use. if the devs read this, please check the steam deck key biding not longer works. cant seem to find a way to fix it.

If you're configuring this on the steam desktop, you'll need a desktop configuration that will allow you to use the controller's inputs as actual gamepad buttons. Otherwise, This emulator works about as well as its other versions do on other PCs and OSes, which is to say pretty good!
summary: Input mapping works, but is definitely not optimized for Steam Deck

description: Works perfectly on Steam Deck both in Desktop and Game Mode.

Keep it up amazing. If you play with a certain cheatcode, that random time your gba game will crash even when playing long game times like hours on that game with cheats on it will crash randomly. Awesome recommended emulator.
controller mapped no problem, just wish there is an option for fullscreen mode instead of using hotkey or console command to do it.

If you want to play some GBA or GBC games with your keyboard or a controller, then just install and have fun. Couldn't be more effective. You can even download it on Windows and Mac and continue with your saves.
Worked perfectly. Easy to get xbox remote working with it.
In the middle of game, suddenly some keys didn't work, even outside the app. When i check to the bios, it goes the same. It brokes my keyboard

app assumes left button is constantly being pressed even when it isnt.
impossible to play any game as i cant move right
Wont recognise Steam Deck controls

LOTR: The Return of the King + The Third Age are way glitched out graphically. In ROTK, the puddle reflection flickers really bad, and on TTA the flank borders do the same thing. And on steam deck its pretty much broken. Sometimes it opens the file browser to pick a game, and sometimes it breaks the toolbar at the top and you can't pick anything, and there's literally no rhyme or reason to it. My emulators on android have none of these problems and run flawlessly, but on steam deck/linux even the alternatives do it too. The toolbars work on the alternatives, but the flickers still there. I'd wait until an update comes out or a decent alternative before getting this.

My pet peeve with emulators is that they don't let you bind both a gamepad input and a keyboard input. Sometimes for GBA games I just want to play on my laptops keyboard without having to rebind all my keys. The emulation is also top notch. I would love a welcome screen with you game art shown like Dolphin or Duckstation, but being a single dev this still deserves a 5* review.
summary: Everything I want in an emulator (except a game library GUI)

description: 1 click install - All games playable without an issue whatsoever

La emulación va perfecta, funciona bien tanto con las roms originales como con los hackroms, buenos fps incluso con equipos antiguos, lo unico que a la hora de cargar los shaders adicionales que vienen con el emulador la aplicacion se congela, no se si sera por la aplicación en si, por en el empaquetado flatpak o si tambien con los .deb pasara lo mismo, pero por lo demas funciona bastante bien la recomiendo, ya si se arreglara la parte de la carga de los shader la pongo 5 estrellas XD, por lo demas buen trabajo
Es el mejor emulador de la consola que existe y con muchísima diferencia, ojalá y siga evolucionando~

I tried to set up shortcut keys for mGBA (Standalone) on Steam Deck. Firstly, the setup window is too long to let Steam Deck to show the "OK" button and "Clear" button at the bottom.

Secondly, when I try to set a shortcut key, mGBA does not listen to the keys such as L4, R4, L5 and R5 at back of the Steam Deck.
summary: It's not compatible with Steam Deck
